channel.description: Recent content in Posts on StatWizard

item.title: Introduction to Natural Language Processing - Part 1
item.description: In this series of blog posts, I am going to describe the journey of Natural Language Processing, how it evolved to reach the Large Language Models that we see today and the mathematics behind their inner workings.

item.title: Determinism to Stochasticity: Why Neural Networks could be the way forward?
item.description: This is more of a philosophical post, concentrated on the history of evolution of scientific approaches: from mathematical laws, statistical modelling and machine learning predictions.

item.title: How to hack into LLMs? Generative AI Series Part 6
item.description: This is the 6th and the final part of the blog post series on Generative AI and Prompting Techniques. In this post, we discuss about the security implications of Generative AI Techniques.

item.title: Chaining Language Model to Algorithm: Generative AI Series Part 5
item.description: This is the 5th part of the blog post series on Generative AI and Prompting Techniques. In this post, we dive into the prompting technique known as function calling and tool use and see them in action.

item.title: Making the most out of Prompts: Generative AI Series Part 4
item.description: This is a series of blog posts on Generative AI and Prompting Techniques. In this post of Generative AI series, we look into different techniques to bring out the best in prompts, along with a popular technique called Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG).

item.title: Designing Prompts: Generative AI Series - Part 3
item.description: This is a series of blog posts on Generative AI and Prompting Techniques. In this post of Generative AI series, we will look into what prompt engineering is, and how to design better prompts to leverage the power of Generative AI in your typical use-cases.

item.title: Generative AI Text-to-Text Models - Part 2
item.description: This is the 2nd blog post on Generative AI and Prompting Techniques blog series. In this post, we dive into encoder-decoder generative AI models and the key tunable settings for the Text-to-Text generative AI models.

item.title: Introduction to Generative AI - Part 1
item.description: This is a series of blog posts on Generative AI and Prompting Techniques. This post serves as a introduction to the generative AI, its related techniques.

item.title: The Mathematics behind Solar Eclipse
item.description: On April 8, 2024, the people in Texas, United States of America, will watch a cosmic event taking place before their very eyes, a total solar eclipse. But how can this be predicted so accurately down to the second in advance, when our weather predictions are often wrong? In this post, we are going to see how simple mathematics can help us predict these cosmic events so precisely.

item.title: Should your program grow memory?
item.description: Recently, I was working on a project where I had to optimize for both time and memory consumption of the program to make it more efficient. In this post, I share a few key insights that I have gained from that.

item.title: LED Screen with Spreadsheet
item.description: Introduction A few days ago, I saw this video by Derek Muller on his channel Veritasium1 and came to know about the discovery of blue LED by Shuji Nakamura2. It was a nice video, (I highly recommend watching it) and I was thinking of how significant that discovery was. To begin with, it led to the creation of smart LED screen that you see on mobile phones, smart TVs, tablets or any other current-era electronic devices.

item.title: Video Background Extraction
item.description: You have often seen that Google meet filters or Zoom background filters allows you to change the background of your video. Ever wondered how that is performed? In this post, I am going to explain precisely that, and the math behind it.

item.title: Is Stock Trading running on a fluke?
item.description: In this post, I explore the question of whether stock trading has better winning odds than gambling on heads or tails in an unbiased coin.

item.title: Building a Storage Analyzer
item.description: Here we will try creating a python program to analyze the storage and find out which files or folders are taking up most spaces.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning (Part 7) - Solving Lunar Landing
item.description: This is the 7th and final part of the Reinforcement Learning Series: Here I give a brief introduction to deep Q-learning and some techniques to increase RL agent’s efficiency

item.title: Reinforcement Learning (Part 6) - Value Function Approximation
item.description: This is the 6th part of the Reinforcement Learning Series: Here I discuss about techniques to work with infinite state space, where the tabular methods do not work

item.title: Reinforcement Learning (Part 5) - Q Learning and Optimal Policy Finding
item.description: This is the 5th part of the Reinforcement Learning Series: Here I discuss about techniques to finding optimal policies, and then demonstrate the popular Q-learning algorithm. I also show how it can be implemented to solve actual problems

item.title: Reinforcement Learning (Part 4) - Temporal Difference Algorithms
item.description: This is the 4th part of the Reinforcement Learning Series: Here I discuss about how the idea of Bellman equations and Monte Carlo methods can be combined into a single algorithm called Temporal Difference. We will also learn about its variants and how we can use it to estimate the value functions.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning (Part 3) - Markov Decision Process
item.description: This is the third part of the Reinforcement Learning series: Here I discuss about the representing the reinforcement learning problem as a markov decision process, explain standard terminologies and provide ways to estimate the value function.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning (Part 2) - K-arm Bandit Problem
item.description: This is the second part of the Reinforcement Learning series: Here I discuss about dynamically balancing between exploration and exploitation to reach optimal return in long run.

item.title: Random Matrix Theory - Introduction
item.description: This is the first introductory post on Random Matrix Theory series: Here I demonstrate some phenemenon about random matrices which are very non-intuitive to the classical thinking of asymptotic result

item.title: Reinforcement Learning (Part 1) - K-arm Bandit Problem
item.description: This is an introductory post about reinforcement learning. Here I discuss about the exploration-exploitation dilemma with multi-armed bandit problem and potential solutions to this.

item.title: Texture Networks
item.description: In this post, I analyse Texture Network, a special type of neural network to synthesize textures and performing Neural Style Transfer, the art of mixing the content of a picture with the style from another picture.

item.title: Analysis of basic Epidemiological models - Part 2
item.description: In this post, we describe a slight generalization of the basic SIR model of epidemiology and its estimation procedure under both frequentist and Bayesian paradigms. We also make projections of the covid cases over next several days based on the fitted model.

item.title: Analysis of basic Epidemiological models - Part 1
item.description: In this post, we describe a basic statistical model of epidemiology, named SIR model and its estimation procedure under both frequentist and Bayesian paradigms.
